content:
Rust currently shows up as language "MASM" in the PDB format because no enumerator value was available. I've been working to get a value assigned to Rust by Microsoft, and I just submitted a review to LLVM to use the new value.

Here's the LLVM review that makes this change.
https://reviews.llvm.org/D115300

I believe no additional changes will be required on the Rust side (other than updating LLVM). Please let me know if I should create an issue, or do something else on the Rust side to help track this.

Nothing more to do unless you want to have this change backported ahead of the LLVM 14 release. If you do, you can submit a cherry-pick on https://github.com/rust-lang/llvm-project after it landed upstream.

The change is committed to LLVM! I created a PR to backport it into the current LLVM used by Rust: https://github.com/rust-lang/llvm-project/pull/126

I'm not sure what the review policy is for this repo. If there's something I'm missing, please let me know.
Change to update the LLVM submodule is in (thanks nikic!). Here's the PR to update rust: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92767
